Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $d$ be real numbers such that
\begin{align*}
a + b + c + d &= 6, \\
a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 &= 12.
\end{align*}Let $m$ and $M$ denote minimum and maximum values of
\[4(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4),\]respectively.  Find $m + M.$
inference:
Solution:
We can write
\begin{align*}
4(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) &= (a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) + 3(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \\
&= (a + b + c + d)(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 - ab - ac - ad - bc - bd - cd) + 3(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \\
&= 6(12 - ab - ac - ad - bc - bd - cd) + 3(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \\
&= 72 - 6(ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd) + 3(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4).
\end{align*}By Cauchy-Schwarz,
\[(1 + 1 + 1 + 1)(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2) \ge (a + b + c + d)^2,\]so $ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd \ge 0.$

Also,
\begin{align*}
(a + b + c + d)^2 &= a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 + 2(ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd) \\
&= 12 + 2(ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd),
\end{align*}so $ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd = 6.$

Then
\begin{align*}
72 - 6(ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd) + 3(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) &= 36 + 3(a^3 + b^3 + c^3 + d^3) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \\
&= 36 + (a + b + c + d)(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 - ab - ac - ad - bc - bd - cd) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \\
&= 36 + 6(12 - 6) - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \\
&= 108 - (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4).
\end{align*}Again by Cauchy-Schwarz,
\[(1 + 1 + 1 + 1)(a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4) \ge (a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2)^2,\]so $a^4 + b^4 + c^4 + d^4 \ge 9.$  Equality occurs when $a = b = c = d = \sqrt{3},$ so $M = 108 - 9 = 99.$

Furthermore, by AM-GM,
\begin{align*}
a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 &= \frac{a^2 + b^2}{2} + \frac{c^2 + d^2}{2} \\
&\ge \sqrt{a^2 b^2} + \sqrt{c^2 d^2} \\
&= ab + cd.
\end{align*}Similarly, $a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 \ge ac + bd$ and $a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 \ge ad + bc.$  Hence,
\[3(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2) \ge ab + ac + ad + bc + bd + cd = 6,\]so $a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 \ge 2.$  Equality occurs when $a = b = \sqrt{2}$ and $c = d = 0,$ so $m = 108 - 4 = 104.$

Therefore, $m + M = 104 + 99 = \boxed{203}.$
